column2: In the United States, there is information voters need to register and vote. Where are you most likely to look for this information? Please select up to three.
column3: If you wanted to know more about how elections are run in the United States, where would you be most likely look for that information? Please select up to three.
column4: If you are interested in learning about the winner of an election, where would you be most likely to look for results? Please select up to three.

column1: A federal agency or website dedicated to elections (e.g. the U.S. Election Assistance Commission or vote.gov)
News media professionals (local/national TV news anchors, journalists, reporters)
Election-related organizations (including integrity and voting rights groups)
Your favorite social media influencer or content creator (e.g. TikTok, X/Twitter, Reels, etc.)
Elected officials at any level (e.g. mayors, governors, Congress members)
Your favorite commentator or analyst from a radio show, podcast, TV show, blog, or newspaper
Fact-checking organizations (e.g. Snopes, PolitiFact, AP Fact Check, etc.)
Civic or religious organizations in your community
